revised_title: Investigation of Experimental Flow Patterns for Plane Strain Extrusion of Hardening Materials with Slipline Field Methods
tldr: This study investigates the flow patterns and forces in the extrusion of aluminum alloys through tapered dies, using slipline field methods. The authors develop a method to construct work-hardening slipline fields based on experimental flow patterns and analyze the differences between observed flow patterns and forces and those predicted by classical plasticity theory. The research provides insights into the behavior of work-hardening materials during extrusion and can help improve the understanding of metal extrusion processes.
